title: If Lee' UIt didn't root in the animation, it would function the same Trist's ult
body:
In the sense that even if you flash ***during the animation***, it wouldn't change the direction of the skill and you just get shot back toward her team anyway. 

This is what the Rioter meant by "wasting your flash"

The problem with these abilities is that they're archaic and the code is dated. My theory (and it's just a theory, maybe Riot can confirm) is that the trajectory is calculated at the time of the cast, instead of after the animation finishes. This is why even if you flash to the opposite side of Trist while she's already in the animation for her ult, you still get launched in the original direction. 

This problem is archaic season 1 spaghetti code. It is also evident in champs like Ez. If you hit Ezreal with a bind, stun, root, etc **after** he starts the animation for his E, he still shifts to his original target, but arrives at his destination rooted.

The only way we're going to fix this is by updating some of the archaic code. Maybe have trajectory be calculated ***at the end of the animation*** as opposed to at the intial cast.

Maybe some Rioter could give us some clarification as to how these things are coded, because it seems to be more of a problem on older champion. There's also things like Casseo ult flashes that exist too

The ability either decides the cast direction at the start or at the end. If it works at the start, then lee sin flashing would not  change the direction. If it worked at the end, then you flashing **would** change the direction.

Anyway, I actually agree with Galios ult taunt being Tenacity-Immune. That one actually makes sense, because the primary way the ability works would be extremely warped if tenacity affected it. It functions like a weaker Suppression in that sense, and the ability would *fall apart* without it.

Lee Sin's kick, however, is a fundamentally different case. It has a cast time-applying a CC before that cast time ends. So Lee Sin's kick **has no cast time**, for most intents and purposes.

Tenacity's descriptions specifically states that taunts' durations are reduced too.

That's why they should rename it.
Do that and there's no problem, because it's true that Galio's ult is handicapped because of Tenacity.

But no, it wouldn't fall apart. Galio could still cancel the ult sooner to ensure enemies get hit by it, regardless of Tenacity.

Cancel the ult earlier for *all* enemies, for the enemies that have tenacity. Canceling the ult earlier according to the wiki has a smaller radius, so you might not hit all your enemies.

More importantly, it'd cause these stupid games of "precision time exactly when the enemy stops being cc'd because of tenacity", because "just cancel the ult sooner" stops being reasonable once you get to any enemy that has a blink (or burns flash). Also, a tenacity free'd champion can negate your channel with a CC, thus prematurely ending it for all other champions.

It's got enough weirdness cases that actually fixing it up to induce the effects of tenacity somehow would be a huge mess for **extremely** small benefit, and I'd rather all that effort go into, say, the full Galio rework.

In video games, there is the effect where whatever kills you most seems really OP. Makes sense right? You die alot to it because it is really very powerful.
However, the fact is that you are only dying alot to it because there is a ton of it happening.

Let's take Call of Duty for an example, Quickscoping specifically.
If you aren't familiar with it, it is basically abusing the perfect accuracy of a scoped sniper rifle by aiming the crosshairs at somebody, and starting to aim down the sights, and firing the INSTANT the game decides you are using the scope. Often you will not even actually SEE the scope on the screen yet, or at least only for a split second, but the game counts it as in use and gives you perfect accuracy.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-iTZb4m5bes

Quickscoping is a SUPER flashy way to play COD, and as a result makes great montages. People see these montages -> try it, and now the game is filled with quickscopers. Now quickscoping seems EXTREMELY OP because you die to it a ton.

In reality, quickscoping isn't that OP, it is just the volume of quickscopers creates this illusion.
